events.title: Establishment of Yellowstone National Park
events.description: Yellowstone National Park, the first national park in the world, was established by the U.S. Congress.
events.significance: It marked the beginning of the national park movement, conserving natural landscapes and wildlife for public enjoyment and ecological preservation.

events.title: Start of the Second Sino-Japanese War
events.description: The Japanese invasion of Manchuria began, leading to the establishment of the puppet state of Manchukuo.
events.significance: This event escalated tensions in East Asia and was a precursor to the broader conflicts of World War II in the Pacific.

events.title: Korean War Begins
events.description: The Korean People's Army crossed the 38th parallel, invading South Korea and igniting the Korean War.
events.significance: This war was a significant Cold War conflict that impacted global geopolitics and led to the ongoing division of Korea.

events.title: Freedom Riders Begin Journey
events.description: The Freedom Riders departed Washington D.C. to challenge segregation on interstate buses in the American South.
events.significance: Their actions were pivotal in the fight against racial segregation and advancing civil rights legislation in the United States.

events.title: Euro Becomes Official Currency
events.description: Euro banknotes and coins were introduced in 12 European Union countries, replacing their national currencies.
events.significance: This was a major milestone in European economic integration, facilitating trade and travel across member states.
